TextView.android:text: 1. How did you integrate Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) into your project? You can provide an example from your source code if necessary.

I was able to build a dependency of multiple blocks in the execution of the game and the navigation within the app itself. The response, instruction, and game fragments are each a java file of their own, calling upon another fragment’s java code when the user navigates. The game itself is a port of my previous project using separate methods which may be called repeatedly, including the actual game cycling and the repeated drawing of a new random card.
2. Did you make use of any algorithms in your code? If yes, explain the use of your algorithm(s).
Within my app, I have relied on a variety of algorithms, most notable, I would say is the function which takes in the state of each card in the deck and randomly assigns the player an untouched card.
3. What part of the finished product are you most proud of? Why?

I am most proud of the fact that I was able to convert my text-based card game into a graphical, android-built card card game. I never paid any attention to how a text-based game may be transformed and this was a great trek and discovery.
4. If you were to create version 2.0, what part would you want to develop further?

I would most likely prioritize “prettying-up” the interface, as of right now, the app’s game is text-based, really. Ideally, I would want the game to incorporate basic animation of the cards being dealt and played, with more toasts/visual animations to demonstrate each cards’ impact.
5. Are there any specific bugs or problems you were unable to solve?

In terms of problems that I did not anticipate and still couldn’t solve as of handing in the final project, none. However, one problem I had anticipated was the difficulty adapting the project to the new and different AndroidX/Jetpack libraries, it hadn’t been out long enough for adequate, in-depth guides and tutorials to be put up on the internet yet.
6. What specific skills and understandings did you gain from working on this project?fragment_response.xml

I was reviewing my android development skills and furthered them while working on this project, I built a more solid understanding of how the fragments work and how they relate to the views in the app. I also learned how to incorporate a navigation bar/menu in this project.
